definition: junior female student or apprentice/daughter (younger than oneself) of one's teacher

sentences.english: Sister Qing, do we need to continue the contest?
sentences.chinese: 清師妹，咱們還須比下去麼？

sentences.english: OK, Zhu is a good man, though he always bother me.
sentences.chinese: 然後，“老大”師妹就說，老祝真的是個好人。

sentences.english: So, the little undergraduate girl, Big Sister, began to believe, This is a good man.
sentences.chinese: 然後，“老大”師妹就說，老祝真的是個好人。

sentences.english: White younger sister Shi, the teacher makes you return to.
Why Shimei determined to move out?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼師妹堅決要搬走？

sentences.english: In recent days, many students will move here.
sentences.chinese: 最近幾天，很多師弟師妹將搬過來這邊。

sentences.english: White younger sister Shi whether have words, can talk with instructor.
sentences.chinese: 白師妹若是有話，可以和師父去講。

sentences.english: My little brothers and sisters will go to school soon.
sentences.chinese: 我的師弟師妹快要上學了，應該可以看的到。

sentences.english: Shimei is now finally could not resist, and to be exploded.
sentences.chinese: 現在師妹終於忍不住了，要爆發了。

sentences.english: He determined to marry his sister Ge and I determine to escape from here!
sentences.chinese: 他立志要娶他葛師妹爲妻，我則立志要逃出生天。

definition: young disciple (of the same master)/younger or junior male schoolmate
senior female fellow student or apprentice/daughter (older than oneself) of one's teacher
senior male fellow student or apprentice/son (older than oneself) of one's teacher
to let off/to let slip by/to let sb get away with sth
Brothers!/brethren/dude (colloquial)/brother (diminutive form of address between males)
to seize an opportunity/to take advantage of situation
to disturb/to look for trouble/to stir up a row/to bother sb intentionally
